column1: It creates small, painful tears in the tendons in your elbow.
Sometimes, tennis elbow surgery is done using an arthroscope.
Before surgery, you will get the same medicines as in open surgery to make you relax and to block pain.

Risks of anesthesia and surgery in general are: - Reactions to medicines or breathing problems - Bleeding, blood clots, or infection Risks of tennis elbow surgery are: - Loss of strength in your forearm - Decreased range of motion in your elbow - Need for long-term physical therapy - Injury to nerves or blood vessels - Scar that is sore when you touch it - Need for more surgery
These include aspirin, ibuprofen, (Advil, Motrin), and naproxen (Naprosyn, Aleve).
Tennis elbow surgery relieves pain for most people.
Many people are able to return to sports and other activities that use the elbow within 4 to 6 months.
